title: Connecting Voices: LoReSpeech as a Low-Resource Speech Parallel Corpus
author: Samy Ouzerrout (Université d'Orléans, France), Yanantic AI, France, ...
relevance_why: The focus on low-resource audio corpora aligns with your interests in enhancing speech technologies for under-represented languages. The methods of aligning audio with transcriptions could be applied to your work in audio generation and restoration.
background: Creating a parallel audio corpus for under-represented languages to improve speech-to-speech translation and automatic speech recognition functionalities.
contribution: This paper introduces the LoReSpeech corpus, aiming to provide a framework for aligning low-resource audio data with their transcriptions, enabling advancements in multilingual speech processing.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily rely on large-scale audio corpora for model training, often overlooking under-represented languages due to data scarcity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work emphasizes the quality of short alignments through community collaboration and robust alignment processes, rather than mass data collection.

key_innovation: Utilizes a two-step validation process for aligning long-form audio to precise verse-level segments, which is particularly critical for low-resource languages.
real_world_impact: The LoReSpeech corpus could significantly improve accessibility and technological inclusivity for speakers of minority languages, promoting their preservation and use in modern applications.
limitations: Dependence on the quality of prior ASR datasets and scalability challenges in extending methodologies to additional languages.

new_terms.Montreal Forced Aligner (MFA): **Montreal Forced Aligner** is a tool used to align text with audio, aiding in the transcription and analysis of spoken language, crucial for constructing aligned speech datasets.
